questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An initially parallel cylindrical beam travels in a medium of refractive index μ(I) = μ₀ + μ₂I, where μ₀ and μ₂ are positive constants and I is the intensity of the light beam. The intensity of the beam is decreasing with increasing radius. The initial shape of the wavefront of the beam is

options.text: convex near the axis and concave near the periphery

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The speed of light in the medium is

options.text: maximum on the axis of the beam
minimum on the axis of the beam
the same everywhere in the beam
directly proportional to the intensity I

questions.concept: Relation between refractive index and speed

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: As the beam enters the medium, it will

options.text: diverge near the axis and converge near the periphery

questions.concept: Beam behavior in varying refractive index medium

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A nucleus of mass M + m is at rest and decays into two daughter nuclei of equal mass M/2 each. Speed of light is c. The speed of daughter nuclei is
questions.concept: Conservation of energy and momentum in nuclear decay

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The binding energy per nucleon for the parent nucleus is E₁ and that for the daughter nuclei is E₂. Then
